org.magnos.util
Class AtomicStack<E>

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.util.AtomicStack<E>
Type Parameters:
E - The element type.
public class AtomicStack<E>
extends java.lang.Object

An implementation of a Lock-Free Stack. This implementation only provides a guarantee for the push and pop operations. The peek and size operations are only valid at the exact instance they are invoked, as soon as a result returns to the invokers that information could be out dated. TODO: find Wait-Free stack.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Detail

push

public void push(E element)
Pushes the given element on top of the stack.

Parameters:
element - The element to push on the stack.

pop

public E pop()
Pops an element from the stop of the stack.

Returns:
The element popped from the stack.

peek

public E peek()
Returns the element on the top of the stack. By the time this method returns the element may already have been popped off of the stack or another element has been pushed on top of it.

Returns:
The element at the top of the stack.

size

public int size()
Returns the approximate size of the stack. This will iterate through the nodes in the stack and for each element a counter will be incremented by one. Its possible that if this method returns some number x that all x nodes could have been popped off by the time this method returns (meaning the current size of the stack is actually zero opposed to x).

Returns:
The number of elements in the stack.
